text.__SUMMARY__: Jordaniella truncatula is a rare  species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Pyramidellidae, the pyrams and their allies.
text.Description: The length of the shell varies between 1.5 mm and 4.5 mm.
text.Distribution:
This marine species occurs in the following locations:
European waters (Greenland, Ireland, Atlantic France)
United Kingdom Exclusive Economic Zone
Atlantic Ocean off the Cape Verdes (at depths between 140 m and 200 m)
text.References: Høisæter, T. (2014). The Pyramidellidae (Gastropoda, Heterobranchia) of Norway and adjacent waters. A taxonomic review. Fauna norvegica. 34: 7-78
